title: Why is 1776 an important year in US history? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Simple school test question, requiring a simple answer. I’ll quote: The United States Declaration of Independence is the statement adopted by the Second Continental Congress meeting at the Pennsylvania State House (now known as Independence Hall) in Philadelphia on July 4, 1776. The Declaration announced that the thirteen American colonies then at war with the Kingdom of Great Britain would regard themselves as thirteen independent sovereign states no longer under British rule. With the Declaration, these new states took a collective first step toward forming the United States of America. The declaration was signed by representatives from New Hampshire, Massachusetts Bay, Rhode Island and Providence Plantations, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Georgia. The Declaration was passed on July 2 with no opposing votes. (Which, of course, didn’t mean all colonists agreed with it.)

The signing of The Declaration Of Independence happened on July 4th, 1776, which is when the Colonists declared the United States Of America as a sovereign nation no longer under Britain’s rule. The USA being born that year might make 1776 an important year in US history.
